content: learning the wet plate collodion process. The first plates, that somehow look like an image. But sure - they are still far from perfect. Shot now ~ thirty plates, glass and tintypes, to come to the first modest results. More than 30 plates with bugs and holes, scratches and fog. But the new ones are getting better and better. Some issues with expossure, some with the chemicals. But pouring the plates feels very natural now. I am realy surprised. There is still a long way to go and a lot to develop ;)

It has a microphone built in where I can set the lights to red, white, on and out via voice control. Also I can set timers via voice. This is controlled via an rasberry pi with rhasspy as voice recognition framework. Cloudfree. Not Alexa, no google.

content:
# Two days after the first attempts with collodion, I spontaneously had the idea of looking for some accessories at an antique market. We arrived late, only a few dealers were left and most of all the stuff more or less had been boring.
One stand stood out. There were old lockers from old eastern german NVA stocks, some old metal cabinets, a few suitcases and a lightweight, portable wooden box with metal fittings. According to the lettering the case of a doctor, maybe 70 years old. It seemed ideal to me to get close to my project of a mobile darkroom with style. Said and done. Bought it for 20 buckes and got a box with old glass syringes together cannulas and some pharmacists. Ideal for my project. Pictures will follow.
summary: # Two days after the first attempts with collodion, I spontaneously had the idea of looking for some accessories at an antique market.

content:
just a small ongoing project to line up shards between infinite and meaningless
‚Ä¶. nothing more
This website was actually conceived to accompany a positive path in the 2020 pandemic. Very quickly, my ideas were shattered by reality. I then quickly threw over the concept of the website. While sorting, I stumbled across the photo of the sunflower at Hambach Castle. Of course, you can't see the reference in the photo. But for me it is symbolic with the break that happened
This project is like all my others just a small ongoing project to line up shards between infinite and meaningless to see what is possible
